elements.name: Legitimacy Chain Panel
elements.problem_it_solves: Users currently start conversations while still wondering whether the person and listing are legitimate, creating early trust drop-off.
elements.why_this_is_a_signature: Category incumbents optimize for message volume; this element makes legitimacy proof the default starting condition before chat.
elements.description: A top-of-listing panel that displays four explicit trust states: identity proof, role proof, payment readiness, and unresolved unknowns. It preserves speed to message, but forces visible evidence ordering before first contact. The panel also includes a one-click disconfirming checklist so users can test assumptions, not just confirm them.

visual_spec.layout: Two-column panel in desktop (evidence list + action rail), stacked on mobile.
visual_spec.border: 1px solid #e5e7eb with 3px top accent in secondary purple.
visual_spec.color_usage: Primary purple anchors headings, secondary purple marks verified states, accent purple marks unresolved unknowns.

interaction_spec.default_state: Four rows visible with status chips: Verified, Partial, Pending, Unknown.
interaction_spec.hover: Row elevates with purple-tinted shadow and reveals source timestamp.
interaction_spec.click: Click opens inline evidence details and source trail.
interaction_spec.animation: Rows fade-up with 180ms stagger and chip color transition over 200ms.
interaction_spec.responsive: Below 768px rows stack full-width and CTA rail moves below evidence list with 48px buttons.

copy_spec.secondary_text: See what is verified, what is still uncertain, and what Split Lease guarantees.
copy_spec.micro_copy: Actions: 'Message now', 'Run disconfirming checklist'. Labels: 'Identity verified', 'Role verified', 'Payment rail ready', 'Unknowns to confirm'.
dont: Do not collapse trust into one badge.
Do not hide unknowns in legal footnotes.
Do not gate proof behind paywalls.

elements.html_css:

before_after.before: Roomster-style discovery rushes users to chat with limited structured trust proof.
before_after.after: Split Lease introduces visible evidence tiers before first message so users can compare risk explicitly.

elements.name: Commitment State Rail Drawer
elements.problem_it_solves: High-stakes terms and payment sequencing currently spill into unstructured chat where responsibility and next action are unclear.
elements.why_this_is_a_signature: Lead-funnel competitors avoid owning commitment liability; this element makes Split Lease own the riskiest decision moment with explicit states.
elements.description: A side drawer with four commitment states: intent, term alignment, verification, and authorization. Each state has one required decision, one owner, and one due time. Users can still chat, but canonical terms are versioned in the drawer and cannot drift into text chaos.

visual_spec.layout: Right-side drawer on desktop, bottom sheet on mobile.
visual_spec.background: White surface over dark translucent overlay.
visual_spec.border: 1px solid #e5e7eb with active step ring in secondary purple.
visual_spec.color_usage: Primary purple for hierarchy, secondary purple for active state, accent purple for caution states.

interaction_spec.default_state: Current state and next owner task visible at top.
interaction_spec.hover: Action buttons gain purple shadow and stronger contrast.
interaction_spec.click: Primary action advances state; secondary action requests edits with audit trail.
interaction_spec.animation: Drawer slides in over 240ms; state card transitions over 180ms.
interaction_spec.responsive: Below 640px becomes full-width bottom sheet with sticky action footer.

copy_spec.secondary_text: Verify terms before authorization. Every next action has a clear owner and deadline.
copy_spec.micro_copy: States: 'Intent confirmed', 'Terms aligned', 'Verification in progress', 'Authorization pending'. Actions: 'Advance', 'Request edits'.
do: Show reversible language before final authorization.
dont: Do not bury terms in chat.
Do not ask for payment before verification.

before_after.before: Users finalize risky commitments in ad hoc text threads.
before_after.after: Split Lease introduces a staged, auditable commitment rail with explicit ownership and deadlines.

elements.name: Availability Truth Timeline
elements.problem_it_solves: Users spend effort on dates that appear available but fail later due to cross-platform conflicts and manual reschedule drift.
elements.why_this_is_a_signature: Most competitors show static availability snapshots; this element exposes synchronized state history and conflict certainty before users negotiate.
elements.description: A compact timeline card attached to listing and proposal views. It shows latest sync source, confidence level for each date block, and a clear conflict flag when availability changed. Reschedule requests reuse the same timeline so users do not lose context between search and agreement.

visual_spec.layout: Vertical card with timeline rail and confidence badges.
visual_spec.color_usage: Secondary purple for reliable states, amber for warning states, red for conflicts.

interaction_spec.default_state: Shows three latest sync events with confidence tags.
interaction_spec.hover: Timeline nodes enlarge slightly and reveal source platform.
interaction_spec.click: Clicking an event opens date-level diff and recommended fallback dates.
interaction_spec.animation: New sync events enter with 160ms fade-slide.
interaction_spec.responsive: On mobile nodes stay vertical with full-width tap targets.

copy_spec.secondary_text: Last synced 6 minutes ago. 2 dates changed since your last view.
copy_spec.micro_copy: Labels: 'High confidence', 'Needs confirmation', 'Conflict detected'. Action: 'See alternatives'.
do: Tie fallback dates to the same context.
dont: Do not hide stale data behind generic timestamps.
Do not separate reschedule from source-of-truth timeline.

before_after.before: Users discover date conflicts late and coordinate reschedules through manual back-and-forth.
before_after.after: Split Lease surfaces synchronized availability truth and conflict-aware alternatives before commitment.

elements.name: Outcome Compounding Debrief Card
elements.problem_it_solves: Without structured closeout, each new housing cycle restarts from scratch and users do not benefit from prior outcomes.
elements.why_this_is_a_signature: Competitors end value at match; this element captures lived-outcome signals and converts them into next-cycle defaults.
elements.description: A one-minute debrief card shown at key milestones and lease end. It asks three high-signal prompts, then previews exactly which trust and matching defaults will update for future decisions. The card links active-stay observations to retention value so users feel compounding benefit.

visual_spec.layout: Single card with quick prompts above an auto-updated defaults preview.
visual_spec.background: White surface with subtle purple diagonal wash.
visual_spec.border: 1px solid #e5e7eb with left accent stripe in secondary purple.
visual_spec.color_usage: Primary purple for summary, secondary purple for selected prompts, accent purple for next-cycle update hints.

interaction_spec.default_state: Three prompt chips and a hidden defaults preview.
interaction_spec.hover: Prompt chips brighten and lift slightly.
interaction_spec.click: Selecting chips reveals updated defaults in real time.
interaction_spec.responsive: On mobile chips stack and primary CTA is fixed to card footer with 48px height.

copy_spec.primary_text: One minute now, safer next match
copy_spec.secondary_text: Tell us what worked and we will carry it into your next shortlist automatically.
copy_spec.micro_copy: Prompts: 'Handoff smooth', 'Rules mismatch', 'Communication reliable'. CTA: 'Save and apply'.
dont: Do not ask long survey questions.
Do not collect feedback without visible payoff.
Do not frame retention as reminders only.

before_after.before: Post-stay feedback is thin, so each new decision starts with little reusable trust memory.
before_after.after: Split Lease captures high-signal outcomes and rewrites future matching defaults automatically.
